quiz.question: I was the greatest non-Roman of my time. I showed concern for the jews in my early reign, but they revolted against me? Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: In his last decade in life, Hedrod became sick and worried about plots against him.

quiz.question: Which king stayed home while his army went to battle?
quiz.additional_info: David once pretended to be crazy, drooling in his beard and scratching at a door like a dog.

quiz.question: Who was famous for serving John the Baptist’s head on a platter on his birthday?
quiz.additional_info: Jesus called Herod Antipas a fox, showing He wasn’t happy with his cunning and deceitful ways.

quiz.question: Who was born clutching his elder brother’s heel?
quiz.additional_info: Jacob and his mother conspired to trick his father into giving him the birthright. Later Laban will trick Jacob into marriage with a different bride.

quiz.question: Pharaoh took a ring off his hand and put it on whose finger?
quiz.additional_info: Joseph became second-in-command of Egypt. He was in a position to save his family from famine.

quiz.question: Who disobeyed God by striking the rock?
quiz.additional_info: Moses was supposed to speak to the rock so that water would flow forth. Instead, in anger, he struck the rock twice with his rod.

quiz.question: I teach the Law and offer sacrifices in the old testament. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Aaron was the first appointed High Priest.

quiz.question: Who commanded the moon and stars to stay still?
quiz.additional_info: Joshua asked, but only the Lord has the power to cause time itself to stand still.

quiz.question: Who needed reassurance from God by putting a fleece of wool on the threshing floor?
quiz.additional_info: The angel of the Lord appeared to Gidean and called him a “mighty man of valour”. He defeated 135 000 Midianites with only 300 of his men.

quiz.question: Who said, “Why have I found favour in your eyes that you notice me- a foreigner”?
quiz.additional_info: It was the tradition for servants to allow their master to put cold feet on them to keep warm at night.

levels.name: Level 02
levels.award_verse: ...and with your feet fitted with the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace.

quiz.question: Who interpreted the handwriting on a wall for Belshazzar?
quiz.additional_info: Daniel also interprets the dream of Nebuchadnezzar.

quiz.question: A king came to visit me because his God had stopped talking to him. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: The witch had no power to call Samuel back from the dead, but God permitted the prophet to appear- scaring the witch out of her wits!

quiz.question: I disobeyed David’s command to spare his son. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Joab was a brave soldier, but his lack of self-control was a big problem for David.

quiz.question: We raided and kidnapped all the women and children of David’s men. Who are we?
quiz.additional_info: Amalek was Esau’s grandson.

quiz.question: My ability to run swiftly was my downfall. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Asahel was “as fleet of foot as a wild gazelle”.

quiz.question: Who said, “What is your servant, that you should regard a dead dog like me?”.
quiz.additional_info: Mephibosheth had lost his father, Jonathan, in battle. He was crippled from a fall when he was young. He had no land or inheritance. David gave him a new position in the palace and treated him like a king’s son.

quiz.question: Saul’s dynasty ended with which King?
quiz.additional_info: Ishbosheth was a weak king and not suited to the role. Two guards assassinated him while he took a nap.

quiz.question: I went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Benaiah earned the rank of third army commander with 24 000 men in his division.

quiz.question: I reached out to save the Ark of God from tipping over. God struck me dead. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Only priests from the tribe of Levi could handle the ark. They were required to carry it on their shoulders.

quiz.question: I was Saul’s highest military official and occupied a seat of honour in the King’s court. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Sometime after Saul’s death, Abner persuaded the twelve tribes of Israel to follow David’s leadership.

levels.name: Level 03
levels.award_verse: ...with the breastplate of righteousness in place,...

quiz.question: What king said, “Behave courageously, and the Lord will be good”?
quiz.additional_info: Jehoshaphat aligned himself with King Ahaziah. So God destroyed his fleet of ships. (2 Chron 20:35-37)

quiz.question: Who threw a bowl of salt into Jericho’s water supply to purify it?
quiz.additional_info: Elisha’s fountain is still an important source of water for Jericho. 2 Kings 2:19-22

quiz.question: Who was the father of many nations?
quiz.additional_info: God blessed Abraham and made him a blessing.

quiz.question: My hair got stuck in a tree when my mule went under an oak tree. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Absalom, David's son, hung from the branches while the mule just kept walking out from under him.

quiz.question: Who was the father of three sons named Shem, Ham, and Japheth?
quiz.additional_info: Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time, and he walked faithfully with God.

quiz.question: Herod Agrippa arrested me. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Herod Agrippa was the nephew of Herod Antipas.

quiz.question: I drove a chariot like a maniac. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Jehu was the son of Jehoshaphat.

quiz.question: I used 12 yokes of oxen to plow my field. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Elisha left all he had to follow Elijah and become his servant.

quiz.question: Who did not think Mary should anoint Jesus's feet with expensive perfume?
quiz.additional_info: The perfume was worth a year's wage. Judas didn't care about the poor. He said this because he used to steal from the money bag.

quiz.question: Who twice called down fire from heaven that consumed a captain and his fifty men?
quiz.additional_info: The third captain fell on his knees and asked Elijah to spare him and his men.

levels.name: Level 04
levels.award_verse: Stand firm then, with the belt of truth buckled around your waist,...

quiz.question: Zacchaeus climbed a fig tree in the city of Jericho to see who?
quiz.additional_info: Zacchaeus was a wealthy chief tax collector before he met Jesus. He gave half of all he owned to the poor.

quiz.question: I spoke a riddle about honey and a lion. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Samson once killed a lion with his bare hands. He would later see bees and honey in its body.

quiz.question: Who was six months older than Jesus?
quiz.additional_info: The angel Gabriel told John's father, Zechariah, that John would go before the Lord in the spirit and power of Elijah.

quiz.question: Who was the first son of Jacob and Rachel?
quiz.additional_info: Benjamin was the second and last son of Jacob and Rachel.

quiz.question: Who found himself on the island of Malta after a shipwreck?
quiz.additional_info: While on the island, A poisonous snake bit Paul, but he suffered no ill effects.

quiz.question: Out of whom did Jesus cast seven demons?
quiz.additional_info: Mary Magdalene was at Jesus' crucifixion.

quiz.question: I predicted that there would be seven years of famine in Egypt. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Joseph also predicted seven years of great abundance would occur before the famine.

quiz.question: I had 700 wives. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all of Israel for forty years.

quiz.question: Which prophet told David God would establish his dynasty, through his son, forever?
quiz.additional_info: When Solomon was born, the Lord sent word through the prophet Nathan to name him Jedidiah, which means beloved of God.

quiz.question: I saw 14 cows in my first dream and 14 heads of grain in my second dream. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Joseph explained that both dreams represented seven years of abundance, followed by seven years of famine.

levels.name: Level 05
levels.award_verse: ... take up the shield of faith, with which you can extinguish all the flaming arrows of the evil one.

quiz.question: I brought my son Samuel to live with the priest Eli. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Eli perceived that the Lord was calling Samuel, so he taught him to respond by saying, "Speak, Lord, for your servant hears."

quiz.question: Which Judge of Israel was called by some 'Jerub-Baal'?
quiz.additional_info: It means 'Let Baal contend with him'. The people called him this because he demolished his father's altar to the false god Baal.

quiz.question: I married King Saul's daughter Michal. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Michal was David's first wife.

quiz.question: Who gave Jesus vinegar mixed with gall when He was on the cross?
quiz.additional_info: David prophesied this event in Psalm 69:21, saying "They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink."

quiz.question: My name was changed to Israel. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: God renamed Jacob Israel because he struggled with God and with humans and had overcome.

quiz.question: Who prayed for Tabitha before God raised her from the dead?
quiz.additional_info: Tabitha was a disciple. She was full of good works and charity.

quiz.question: Who said "As for me and my house, we will serve the LORD"?
quiz.additional_info: On Mount Ebal, in the presence of the Israelites, Joshua wrote on stones a copy of the law of Moses.

quiz.question: Which prophet made a widow's oil and meal last days?
quiz.additional_info: Elijah had her make him a small cake of bread before God did the miracle.

quiz.question: Who disobeyed God when God asked him to "...speak to the rock before their eyes, that it may yield its water."?
quiz.additional_info: Instead, he struck the rock in anger. Because of this, Moses and Aaron would not be allowed into the Promised Land.

quiz.question: I joined two disciples on the road to Emmaus. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: They finally realized who He was when he took bread, gave thanks, and broke it.

levels.name: Level 06
levels.award_verse: ...and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.

quiz.question: I am the daughter-in-law of Naomi. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: After the marriage of Boaz and Ruth, Ruth gives birth to a son, Obed. Obed will grow up to become the father of Jesse, who is the father of King David.

quiz.question: I took a vow and shaved my head in Cenchrea, a port of Corinth. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Corinth was the capital of the Roman province Achaia. It was a prosperous city but also known for its immorality.

quiz.question: Who pleaded with God to spare Sodom?
quiz.additional_info: Abraham underestimated God's justice and mercy and overestimated the goodness of humanity.

quiz.question: Who, when the Lord appeared to him with a sword in His hand, removed his sandals and worshipped Him?
quiz.additional_info: God is not here to take sides. He has come to take over. When we submit to Jesus the victory comes.

quiz.question: Who was thrown into a lion's den by Darius?
quiz.additional_info: When Darius saw that Daniel was unharmed by the lions, he decreed that all people must fear and reverence Daniel's God.

quiz.question: Who bought from Naomi all the property of Elimelek, Kilion, and Mahlon?
quiz.additional_info: Boaz would redeem both the property and the posterity of Elimelech; and take Ruth, the woman he loved, as his wife.

quiz.question: Who put a tree in the waters of Mariah, making the water sweet?
quiz.additional_info: "Marah" means bitterness. Making the waters sweet by throwing the tree into the bitter waters represents Christ, the Son of Man.

quiz.question: Which woman led an army into battle?
quiz.additional_info: When Barak said without Deborah he would not go into battle as God commanded, without hesitation Deborah courageously agreed to go.

quiz.question: Who told the Lord that he was slow of speech and tongue?
quiz.additional_info: God reminded Moses who it was that created the human mouth and that He would help him. Even still, Moses asked God to send someone else.

quiz.question: The cup found in Benjamin's bag belonged to who?
quiz.additional_info: Joseph tests his brothers' hearts by planting the cup in their sacks.

levels.name: Level 07
levels.award_verse: All around him was a glowing halo...

quiz.question: Who cursed a fig tree?
quiz.additional_info: If you saw leaves on a fig tree, you could also expect fruit unless the tree was barren. Likewise, many people look holy on the outside but are spiritually empty on the inside.

quiz.question: Who prayed to the Lord and raised the Shunammite woman's son from the dead?
quiz.additional_info: Elisha would later tell the woman to leave her land and possessions because the drought was coming in the future.

quiz.question: When I looked inside the fire, I saw four people walking around within it unharmed. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego were thrown into the fire because they refused to worship the image of a false god. The real God showed up and saved them from certain death.

quiz.question: Jesus asked the Samaritan woman for a drink from whose well?
quiz.additional_info: Jacob's well was in a town in Samaria called Sychar, near the plot of land  Jacob had given to his son Joseph.

quiz.question: I disobeyed God and went to Tarshish instead of Nineveh. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Jonah wanted Nineveh destroyed. He went to Tarshish because he knew God was gracious and compassionate and would not destroy them if they repented.

quiz.question: My name was Sarai before God changed it. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: God blessed Sarah so that she would be the mother of nations.

quiz.question: Who loaded 200 loaves of bread, 2 skins of wine, 5 dressed sheep, 5 seahs of roasted grain, 100 cakes of raisins, and 200 cakes of pressed figs onto donkeys?
quiz.additional_info: Abigail delivered a humble and heartfelt plea for David to spare her husband's household.

quiz.question: Who said to Elijah, "Is that you, you troubler of Israel?".
quiz.additional_info: King Ahab did more evil in the eyes of the LORD than any of those before him.

quiz.question: I asked God for a discerning heart to govern His people and to distinguish between right and wrong. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Before this, Solomon humbled himself before God saying "I am only little child and do not know how to carry out my duties."

quiz.question: Who was the brother of Miriam, the son of Amram and Jochebed?
quiz.additional_info: Moses' older brother Aaron was three years older than him.

levels.name: Level 08
levels.award_verse: They will soar on wings like eagles...

quiz.question: Who grabbed lions and bears by their fur and killed them?
quiz.additional_info: David was Ruth and Boaz's great grandson.

quiz.question: Who is the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth?
quiz.additional_info: A witness is someone who sees an event and testifies about it. Jesus sees everything.

quiz.question: Who was led on horseback through the streets proclaiming, "This is what is done for the man the king delights to honor!"?
quiz.additional_info: Mordecai had hope in God's callings and provisions.

quiz.question: Jesus rebuked the high fever of whose mother-in-law?
quiz.additional_info: Jesus heals. He is the same yesterday, today, and forever.

quiz.question: Who died with his sons in a battle on Mount Gilboa?
quiz.additional_info: His armor-bearer and all his soldiers also died together that day.

quiz.question: Who tried to bind Samson with new, unused ropes?
quiz.additional_info: Delilah was from the valley of Sorek, located about 12½ miles southwest of Jerusalem.

quiz.question: Whose fortunes were restored and doubled when he prayed for his friends?
quiz.additional_info: Throughout his life, Job had fourteen sons and six daughters.

quiz.question: Who did Moses and Elijah meet with on a mountain?
quiz.additional_info: Peter would write, "...We ourselves heard this voice that came from heaven when we were with Him on the sacred mountain."

quiz.question: I ordered my men to strike Amnon down. Who am I?
quiz.additional_info: Absalom would eventually try to overthrow his father David as King.

quiz.question: Who said to Jesus, "...For no one could perform the signs you are doing if God were not with him."?
quiz.additional_info: Nicodemus was a member of the Sanhedrin. The ruling council in Jerusalem.

levels.name: Level 09
levels.award_verse: They will soar on wings like eagles...

quiz.question: Who was the mother of Jesus?
Who killed Goliath'?
Who was Abraham's wife?
Which disciple denied Jesus three times?
Who was the first king of Israel?
Who was converted by Jesus on the road to Damascus?
Who was converted by Jesus on the road to Damascus?
Who was converted by Jesus on the road to Damascus?
Who was converted by Jesus on the road to Damascus?
Who was converted by Jesus on the road to Damascus?
